parameters.description: Return only transactions on or after this date. Required if end_date is provided. If not provided, defaults to the furtherest date allowed by the user's subscription.
parameters.name: start_date

delete.description: Deletes a particular category by its ID. This will delete all budgets within the category, and uncategorize all transactions assigned to the category.

parent_id.description: The unique identifier of a parent category for the category, making this category a child of that category.

title.description: A new title for the category.

put.description: Updates the title, colour or parent of the category.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the category.
parameters.name: id

apply_to_all.description: Apply the created category rule to all transactions.

apply_to_uncategorised.description: Apply the created category rule to all uncategorised transactions.

payee_matches.description: The keyword/s to match the transaction payees.

post.description: Creates a rule to allocate a category to transactions.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction. A positive amount is a credit, and a negative amount is a debit.

category_id.description: The unique identifier of a category for the transaction.

cheque_number.description: A cheque number for the transaction.

date.description: The date when the transaction occurred.

is_transfer.description: Whether the transaction should be indicated as a transfer.

labels.description: A set of comma-separated labels for the transaction.

note.example: I really enjoyed the loaded corn chips

amount.description: A new amount for the transaction.

is_transfer.description: Whether the transaction is a transfer or not.

memo.description: A new memo for the transaction.

delete.description: Unassigns a particular attachment by its ID from the transaction ID. This does not delete the attachment, it only removes its association from the transaction.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

get.description: Gets a user by ID. You must be authorised as the target user in order to make this request.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.
parameters.name: id

always_show_base_currency.description: Whether the user wishes to have all monetary values converted to their base currency.

base_currency_code.description: A new base currency code for the user.

beta_user.description: Whether the user is a beta user, and wishes to try out new features.

email.description: A new email address for the user.

name.description: A new name for the user.

time_zone.description: A new time zone for the user.

week_start_day.description: The day of the week the user wishes their calendars to start on. A number between 0 and 6, where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday.

parameters.name: id

accounts.description: List the account objects in their new display order.

get.description: Lists attachments belonging to a user by their ID.

file_data.description: The base64-encoded contents of the source file. The supported file types are png, jpg, pdf, xls, xlsx, doc, docx.

file_name.description: The file name of the attachment.

title.description: The title of the attachment. If the title is blank or not provided, the title will derived from the file name.

post.description: Creates an attachment belonging to the user by their ID.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Whether parent categories should have their children rolled up into them. When used, the children will still appear in the collection on their own, but their actual and forecast figures will be rolled up to the root parent.
parameters.name: roll_up

get.description: Lists the user's budget, consisting of one or more budget analysis packages, one per category. Akin to the list on the Budget page in PocketSmith.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The period to analyse in, one of `weeks`, `months` or `years`. Also supported is `event`, although event period analysis is only possible when the budget events gathered align, so in this case where all categories are analysed together, it's highly unlikely that event period analysis will be possible.
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: The period interval, e.g. if the interval is 2 and the period is weeks, the budget will be analysed fortnightly.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The date to start analysing the budget from. This will be bumped out to make full periods as necessary.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The date to stop analysing the budget from. This will be bumped out to make full periods as necessary.
parameters.name: end_date

get.description: Get the user's budget summary, containing an expense and income analysis for all categories (excluding transfer categories) for the given period and date range. Akin to the overall budget shown on the Budget page in PocketSmith.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.
parameters.name: id

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: page

get.description: Lists transactions belonging to a user by their ID.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The period to analyse in, one of `weeks`, `months` or `years`. Also supported is `event`, although event period analysis is only possible when the budget events gathered align, so in this case where all categories are analysed together, it's highly unlikely that event period analysis will be possible.
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: The period interval, e.g. if the interval is 2 and the period is weeks, the budget will be analysed fortnightly.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The date to start analysing the budget from. This will be bumped out to make full periods as necessary.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The date to stop analysing the budget from. This will be bumped out to make full periods as necessary.
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of category IDs to analyse.
parameters.name: categories

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of scenario IDs to analyse. You're likely going to want to include all a user's scenarios here, unless you have reason to only analyse for a subset of scenarios. Regardless of what scenarios are analysed, all actuals (transactions) across all accounts will be included.
parameters.name: scenarios

get.description: Get an income and/or expense budget analysis for the given date range and period across any number of categories and scenarios. Akin to the Trends page in PocketSmith.

currency_code.description: The currency code for the account.

current_balance.description: The current balance of the account.

current_balance_date.description: The date of the current balance.

current_balance_exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate between the account's currency and the user's base currency, when different. If the currencies are the same, null is returned.

current_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current balance of the account in the user's base currency.

id.description: The unique identifier of the account.

is_net_worth.description: Whether the account is a net worth asset.

safe_balance.description: The current safe balance, if safe balance is activated on the account. If safe balance is not activated, then null is returned.

safe_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current safe balance in the user's base currency, if safe balance is activated on the account. If safe balance is not activated, then null is returned.

scenarios.description: All scenarios that compose the account, including the primary.

transaction_accounts.description: All transaction accounts that compose the account, including the primary.

updated_at.description: When the account was last updated.

content_type.description: The content type of the attachment.

description.description: The content type description of the attachment

extension.description: The extension type of the attachment

title.description: The content type title of the attachment

file_name.description: The file name of the attachment

id.description: The unique identifier of the attachment

title.description: The title of the attachment. If blank or not provided, the title will be derived from the file name.

updated_at.description: When the attachment was last updated

large_url.description: The url of the large version of the attachment

thumb_url.description: The url of the thumb version of the attachment

average_actual_amount.description: The average actual (transactions) amount across all periods.

average_forecast_amount.description: The average budgeted amount across all periods.

end_date.description: The end date of the budget analysis.

periods.description: The period analyses that this budget analysis comprises.

start_date.description: The start date of the budget analysis.

total_actual_amount.description: The total actual (transactions) amount across all periods.

total_forecast_amount.description: The total budgeted amount across all periods.

total_over_by.description: The total amount the budget was exceeded across all periods.

total_under_by.description: The total amount the budget was under by across all periods.

is_transfer.description: Whether the expense budget analysis looks like a transfer to the income budget analysis, based on a number of heuristics.

id.description: The unique identifier of the category.

is_transfer.description: Whether this category has been marked as a transfer category.

parent_id.description: The unique identifier of the parent category of this category, or null if this category has no parent (i.e. is a top-level category)

updated_at.description: When the category was last updated.

created_at.description: When the category rule was created.

id.description: The unique identifier of the category rule.

payee_matches.description: The keyword/s to match the transactions payees.

updated_at.description: When the category rule was last updated.

error.description: A message describing the error that occurred.
error.example: A message describing the error that occurred.

currency_code.description: The currency code of the institution.

id.description: The unique identifier of the institution.

updated_at.description: When the institution was last updated.

actual_amount.description: The sum of all actuals (transactions) in the period.

current.description: Whether this period is current, such that the current date (in the user's time zone) falls within the date range.

end_date.description: The end date of the period.

forecast_amount.description: The sum of all forecast sources (budget events) in the period, for comparison against the actual amount.

over_budget.description: Whether the budget has been exceeded in the period.

over_by.description: How much the budget has been exceeded by in the period.

percentage_used.description: The percentage of the budget that has been used in the period.

refund_amound.description: This attribute tracks the amount that has been refunded or deducted to the actual amount. When a category is set to "always expense", any credit transactions are treated as refunds and when set to "always income", any debit transactions are treated as deductions.

start_date.description: The start date of the period.

under_budget.description: Whether the budget has not been exceeded in the period.

under_by.description: How much there is left in the budget for the period.

achieve_date.description: For goals, the date that they should be achieved by.

closing_balance.description: The closing balance of the scenario.

closing_balance_date.description: The date of the closing balance.

current_balance.description: The current balance of the scenario.

current_balance_date.description: The date of the current balance.

current_balance_exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate between the scenario's currency and the user's base currency, when different. If the currencies are the same, null is returned.

current_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current balance of the scenario in the user's base currency.

description.description: A short description of what the scenario is modelling.

id.description: The unique identifier of the scenario.

interest_rate.description: The amount of interest to apply to the balance. Will apply periodically depending on what `interest_rate_repeat_id` is set to.

interest_rate_repeat_id.description: A number representing how often the interest should be applied. 0 is used for no interest, 2 is weekly, 3 is fortnightly, 4 is monthly, 5 is yearly and 7 for quarterly.

safe_balance.description: The current safe balance in the user's base currency, if safe balance is activated on the account associated with the scenario. If safe balance is not activated, then null is returned.

safe_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current safe balance in the user's base currency, if safe balance is activated on the account associated with the scenario. If safe balance is not available, then null is returned.

starting_balance.description: The starting balance of the scenario.

starting_balance_date.description: The date of the starting balance.

updated_at.description: When the scenario was last updated.

closing_balance.description: The closing balance of the account at the transaction.

date.description: The date the transaction took place.

id.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

is_transfer.description: Whether the transaction was a transfer.

note.example: I spent way too much on cheese here

original_payee.description: The payee the transaction was created with.

status.description: The status of the transaction. Pending transactions are temporary and may be superseded later by their posted counterparts, which are permanent.

type.description: Whether the transaction is a debit or a credit

currency_code.description: The currency that the account is in. This is determined by the account that the transaction account belongs to.

current_balance_exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate between the transaction account's currency and the user's base currency, when different. If the currencies are the same, null is returned.

current_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current balance of the transaction account in the user's base currency.

safe_balance.description: The current safe balance, if safe balance is activated and available for the transaction account. If safe balance is not available, then null is returned.

safe_balance_in_base_currency.description: The current safe balance in the user's base currency, if safe balance is activated and available for the transaction account. If safe balance is not available, then null is returned.

type.description: The type of the transaction account.

always_show_base_currency.description: Whether the user wants to see all accounts in their base currency instead of the native account currency.

avatar_url.description: The URL to the user's avatar.

beta_user.description: Whether the user has opted in to beta features.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user.

last_activity_at.description: When the user last interacted with PocketSmith, via any application or the API.

last_logged_in_at.description: When the user last logged into PocketSmith.

name.description: The full name of the user, although not all users will have a name set.

updated_at.description: When the user was last updated.

using_multiple_currencies.description: Whether the user has multiple currencies in use across their account.

week_start_day.description: The day of the week the user wishes their calendars to start on. A number between 0 and 6, where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday.

developerKey.description: If you want to build a tool just for yourself, be it a desktop widget to display your balances or a tool to import transactions from a bank without a bank feed, you can use our developer keys feature. You can issue yourself a key which will give you persistent API access to just your account. You should rotate your keys regularly.
developerKey.name: X-Developer-Key

oauth2.description: If you want to a create an app for PocketSmith that other PocketSmith users can use, you'll be using OAuth 2. To register an app with PocketSmith, please email us on api@pocketsmith.com. Let us know a bit about yourself and what you plan on building. When approved, you will be provided with your client_id and client_secret to start using OAuth. Then, check out our guide for integrating OAuth to get started.

scopes.accounts.read: Access to list and view transaction accounts
scopes.accounts.write: Access to update and delete transaction accounts
scopes.attachments.write: Ability to create, update and delete attachments
scopes.categories.write: Ability to edit and delete categories
scopes.transactions.read: Access to list and view accounts and transactions
scopes.transactions.write: Access to create, update and delete transactions
scopes.user.read: Access the user's details and preferences
scopes.user.write: Access to change the user's details and preferences
